name: happy-hour-letter-of-the-law
title: Happy Hour: Letter Of The Law
author: Christy Frink
contentEncoded:
• The Sommet Group, who lost their naming rights for the downtown arena to Bridgestone a few months back, seems to be continuing on a downward spiral. While being investigated for all kinds of tax-related shadiness, their CEO and his wife were found to be in contempt of court for misplacing documents and computers that are pertinent to the investigation. [WSMV]
  • We always love to see our favorite hangouts get some national attention, which is probably why we were so excited to see The Patterson House in GQ’s list of the 25 Best Cocktail Bars in America. [WKRN]
  • In case you’re playing along at home, the Music City Center is 10% complete. [WSMV]
  • The Preds penned a new deal with 102.9 FM The Buzz, making it their official flagship station that will broadcast all their games. Speaking of the Preds, the preseason kicks off tomorrow and if you see some green spandex, we certainly had nothing to do with it. [City Paper]

Photo by O Pish Posh.
